DOCNAME: CASE OF IRINA FEDOTOVA v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6 on account of the quashing of two judgments;Not necessary to examine the allegation of procedural unfairness in the supervisory-review proceedings;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention and domestic proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in DATE she lodged an action against the electricity supplier , seeking to have her home connected to the electricity supply network and asking for compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found for the applicant . That judgment was quashed on appeal on DATE and re - examination of the case was ordered .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action . The judgment became enforceable on DATE when ORG upheld it on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG , acting upon the applicant 's request , quashed the judgments of DATE and DATE , by way of supervisory - review proceedings , and remitted the case for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant 's action and ordered that the company connect the applicant 's home and pay her MONEY ( ORG , approximately CARDINAL euros ) in compensation . The judgment was upheld on appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . Enforcement proceedings were opened and on DATE the applicant received the awarded compensation , but the company refused to connect her home because it did not meet certain technical requirements . Thus , the applicant complained to a court that the bailiffs had failed to enforce the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , as upheld on appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG held that the bailiffs had been inactive in securing the execution of the judgment in the part concerning provision of electricity . ORG furthermore informed the applicant of the possibility of lodging a separate civil claim for damages against the local treasury . It appears that the applicant did not lodge such a claim .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the company connected the applicant 's home to the electricity network .
CARDINAL . On DATE a Deputy President of ORG of GPE introduced an application for supervisory review of the judgments of DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE by way of supervisory review and remitted the matter for a fresh examination . The ORG held that the District and the Regional courts had incorrectly assessed the facts of the case and misinterpreted the relevant legal norms .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . However , the applicant was not ordered to repay the compensation of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL and her house was not disconnected from the electricity network .

CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an application before ORG , complaining about a violation of her rights in the course of the abovementioned domestic proceedings . On DATE she received an empty envelope from the ORG . The applicant complained to ORG about unlawful actions of the ORG post office . On DATE ORG instructed her to correct certain defects of her statement of claim by DATE . That instruction was upheld on appeal on DATE . There is no indication that the applicant fulfilled the courts ' instructions and apparently no further action has been taken .
